course.subject: LANG
course.name: English Communication for Humanities and Social Science Studies II
course.description: Restricted to students on programs offered by the School of Humanities and Social Science. The course builds on the critical reading and thinking skills students have developed, and prepares them for writing up long documents such as project reports and dissertations, with special attention paid to the demands on students from various Humanities and Social Science disciplines.

reviews.author: chimz
reviews.comment_content:
not much help in writing literature review, doing lit review is the ultimate goal of this course:

The breakdown of course content:
Critical reading
How to do a critique in journal article
Conference proposal writing
Audience Analysis / Literary Devices
Literature Review Writing

Few pages are extremely important, but almost the whole book is ...
(p.8 sample link, p.19 sample, p.40, 44-46, 48, 51)
reviews.comment_teaching:
not sure how to grade this item, depend on what you are referring to
during class hour: lots of laughters, cheers (this is absolutely wonderful, LANG class should be like that)
outside class: individual consultation helps, but all depends on your expectation and incentives in this course
reviews.comment_workload:
20% oral journal article critique (assessment in week 4-5, pick one article from the designated sub-themes)

10% conference paper proposal (due in week 6, max. 150 words, set up your own lit review topic under the designated sub-themes)

45% literature review (one draft: 20% + final version: 25%, 2200-2500 words)

25% oral presentation on literature review (assessment in week 12 friday)

all tasks are individually assessed. NO GROUP WORK.

reviews.author: alexchw
reviews.comment_content: I think it is very similar with other lang course, lots of information but not that interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think Amy is the best instructor I have ever seen in different kind of lang class. She tried to ignite your passion of studying and she is a nice person who spent much time on our assignment and giving feedback. I strongly advise my 師弟師妹 to choose Amy's class in lang2070 and lang3070.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading system is not clear, I mean you won't know your score in every assignments. The grading column is as follows:
5% - Attendance (will minus one mark if you absent without reason one time)
20% - Journal article critique
10% - Conference paper proposal
15% - Draft of conference paper
25% - Final version of conference paper
25% - Presentation of the conference

I think the grade is still acceptable, even I don't think my English is good, I got a B.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload is fine comparing with the lang2070, I would say I prefer individual paper which self-decided topic instead of creating info-graphic poster. I doubt whether such thing is useful...
For the workload of this course, u need to have done a presentation and literature review and the sharing in conference, which is fine.
